intro: Nepeta praetervisa, commonly known as the purple catmint, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features slender, upright stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Nepeta praetervisa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
